Thus the the evaluation of the m𝑚mitalic_m-th marginal gain ends. ∎

Now we can prove Lemma 6.

Proof.

First of all, we prove the second result in the Lemma 6. Conditioned on the event ℰℰ\mathcal{E}caligraphic_E , we have that if the amsubscript𝑎𝑚a_{m}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT element is added to Smsubscript𝑆𝑚S_{m}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then

Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w≥Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w^−βt≥w−ϵ′.ΔFsuperscriptsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚𝑇wΔFsuperscriptsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚𝑇^wsubscript𝛽𝑡𝑤superscriptitalic-ϵ′\displaystyle\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}\geq\Delta\textbf{F}(S% _{m},a_{m})^{T}\hat{\textbf{w}}-\beta_{t}\geq w-\epsilon^{\prime}.roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w ≥ roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG w end_ARG - italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ italic_w - italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

If the amsubscript𝑎𝑚a_{m}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT element is not added to Smsubscript𝑆𝑚S_{m}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then

Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w≤Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w^+βt≤w+ϵ′.ΔFsuperscriptsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚𝑇wΔFsuperscriptsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚𝑇^wsubscript𝛽𝑡𝑤superscriptitalic-ϵ′\displaystyle\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}\leq\Delta\textbf{F}(S% _{m},a_{m})^{T}\hat{\textbf{w}}+\beta_{t}\leq w+\epsilon^{\prime}.roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w ≤ roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT over^ start_ARG w end_ARG + italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_w + italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .

Next, we prove our first result, which provides the theoretical guarantee of sample complexity. The proof depends on Lemma 8. By Lemma 8, and the definition of βtsubscript𝛽𝑡\beta_{t}italic_β start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have that

Ct⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖At−1≥max⁡{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}.subscript𝐶𝑡subscriptnormΔFsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚superscriptsubscriptA𝑡1superscriptitalic-ϵ′𝑤ΔFsuperscriptsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚𝑇w2superscriptitalic-ϵ′\displaystyle C_{t}||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})||_{\textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}}\geq% \max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}% {2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}.italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≥ roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } .

Similar to the proof in Lemma 5, we have that the sampled element itsubscript𝑖𝑡i_{t}italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT satisfies

‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖At−1≤pit∗Tit⁢(t)⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖Λ−1,subscriptnormΔFsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚superscriptsubscriptA𝑡1superscriptsubscript𝑝subscript𝑖𝑡subscript𝑇subscript𝑖𝑡𝑡subscriptnormΔFsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚superscriptΛ1\displaystyle||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})||_{\textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}}\leq\sqrt{% \frac{p_{i_{t}}^{*}}{T_{i_{t}}(t)}}||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})||_{\Lambda^% {-1}},| | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ square-root start_ARG divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) end_ARG end_ARG | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

where Λ=∑i∈[m]pi∗⁢Δ⁢F⁢(Si,ai)⁢Δ⁢F⁢(Si,ai)TΛsubscript𝑖delimited-[]𝑚superscriptsubscript𝑝𝑖ΔFsubscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖ΔFsuperscriptsubscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖𝑇\Lambda=\sum_{i\in[m]}p_{i}^{*}\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{i},a_{i})\Delta\textbf{F}(S% _{i},a_{i})^{T}roman_Λ = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. Therefore, before the marginal gain of adding aitsubscript𝑎subscript𝑖𝑡a_{i_{t}}italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT to Sitsubscript𝑆subscript𝑖𝑡S_{i_{t}}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is sampled at time t𝑡titalic_t, we have

Tit⁢(t)≤pit∗⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖Λ−12⁢Ct2max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2.\displaystyle T_{i_{t}}(t)\leq\frac{p_{i_{t}}^{*}||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m% })||^{2}_{\Lambda^{-1}}C_{t}^{2}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta% \textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}.italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_t ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG .

For any other marginal gain with index i𝑖iitalic_i, suppose t~~𝑡\tilde{t}over~ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG is the last time Δ⁢F⁢(Si,ai)ΔFsubscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{i},a_{i})roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is sampled, and that τ′superscript𝜏′\tau^{\prime}italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the total number of samples, then

Ti⁢(τ′)=Ti⁢(t~)+1≤pi∗⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖Λ−12⁢Cτ′2max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2+1.\displaystyle T_{i}(\tau^{\prime})=T_{i}(\tilde{t})+1\leq\frac{p_{i}^{*}||% \Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})||^{2}_{\Lambda^{-1}}C_{\tau^{\prime}}^{2}}{\max% \{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},% \epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}+1.italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) = italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( over~ start_ARG italic_t end_ARG ) + 1 ≤ divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 1 .

Since Ti⁢(τ′)subscript𝑇𝑖superscript𝜏′T_{i}(\tau^{\prime})italic_T start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) is the total number of samples to the marginal gain Δ⁢F⁢(Si,ai)ΔFsubscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{i},a_{i})roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) including the past samples, then the total number of samples of Δ⁢F⁢(Si,ai)ΔFsubscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{i},a_{i})roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) during the evaluation of Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)ΔFsubscript𝑆𝑚subscript𝑎𝑚\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) is upper bounded by

max⁡{pi∗⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖Λ−12⁢Cτ′2max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2+1−Ni(m),0}.\displaystyle\max\{\frac{p_{i}^{*}||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})||^{2}_{% \Lambda^{-1}}C_{\tau^{\prime}}^{2}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta% \textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}+1-N_{i}^{(% m)},0\}.roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 } .

Summing over all elements, we would get

τ𝜏\displaystyle\tauitalic_τ ≤∑i∈[m]max⁡{pi∗⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖Λ−12⁢Cτ′2max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2+1−Ni(m),0}\displaystyle\leq\sum_{i\in[m]}\max\{\frac{p_{i}^{*}||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a% _{m})||^{2}_{\Lambda^{-1}}C_{\tau^{\prime}}^{2}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}% +|w-\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}+% 1-N_{i}^{(m)},0\}≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 }
≤∑i∈[m]max⁡{pi∗⁢‖Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)‖Λ−12⁢Cτ+N(m)2max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2+1−Ni(m),0},\displaystyle\leq\sum_{i\in[m]}\max\{\frac{p_{i}^{*}||\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a% _{m})||^{2}_{\Lambda^{-1}}C_{\tau+N^{(m)}}^{2}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+% |w-\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}+1% -N_{i}^{(m)},0\},≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT | | roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) | | start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ + italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 } ,

where N(m)superscript𝑁𝑚N^{(m)}italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the total number of samples in the offline dataset. By Lemma 13, it follows that

τ𝜏\displaystyle\tauitalic_τ ≤∑i∈[m]max⁡{pi∗⁢ρ(m)⁢Cτ+N(m)2max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2+1−Ni(m),0},\displaystyle\leq\sum_{i\in[m]}\max\{\frac{p_{i}^{*}\rho^{(m)}C_{\tau+N^{(m)}}% ^{2}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}% \textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}+1-N_{i}^{(m)},0\},≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ + italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 } ,

where ρ(m)superscript𝜌𝑚\rho^{(m)}italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the optimal value of the optimization problem in (14). Let us denote Hi(m)=pi∗⁢ρ(m)max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2H_{i}^{(m)}=\frac{p_{i}^{*}\rho^{(m)}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta% \textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon^{\prime}\}^{2}}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG and Hϵ(m)=∑i∈[m]Hi(m)=ρ(m)max{ϵ′+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ′}2H_{\epsilon}^{(m)}=\sum_{i\in[m]}H_{i}^{(m)}=\frac{\rho^{(m)}}{\max\{\frac{% \epsilon^{\prime}+|w-\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon% ^{\prime}\}^{2}}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG. Then the inequality above is

τ𝜏\displaystyle\tauitalic_τ ≤∑i∈[m]max⁡{Hi(m)⁢Cτ+N(m)2+1−Ni(m),0}.absentsubscript𝑖delimited-[]𝑚superscriptsubscript𝐻𝑖𝑚superscriptsubscript𝐶𝜏superscript𝑁𝑚21superscriptsubscript𝑁𝑖𝑚0\displaystyle\leq\sum_{i\in[m]}\max\{H_{i}^{(m)}C_{\tau+N^{(m)}}^{2}+1-N_{i}^{% (m)},0\}.≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ + italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 } . (16)

It then follows that

τ𝜏\displaystyle\tauitalic_τ ≤Hϵ(m)⁢Cτ+N(m)2+mabsentsuperscriptsubscript𝐻italic-ϵ𝑚superscriptsubscript𝐶𝜏superscript𝑁𝑚2𝑚\displaystyle\leq H_{\epsilon}^{(m)}C_{\tau+N^{(m)}}^{2}+m≤ italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_τ + italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_m (17)

Similar to the proof of Theorem 3, we have that

τ𝜏\displaystyle\tauitalic_τ ≤∑i∈[m]max⁡{4⁢Hi(m)⁢R2⁢(2⁢log⁡2δ+d⁢log⁡M(m))+1−Ni(m),0}.absentsubscript𝑖delimited-[]𝑚4superscriptsubscript𝐻𝑖𝑚superscript𝑅222𝛿𝑑superscript𝑀𝑚1superscriptsubscript𝑁𝑖𝑚0\displaystyle\leq\sum_{i\in[m]}\max\{4H_{i}^{(m)}R^{2}(2\log\frac{2}{\delta}+d% \log M^{(m)})+1-N_{i}^{(m)},0\}.≤ ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { 4 italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG + italic_d roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 } .

where M(m)=16⁢Hϵ(m)⁢R2⁢L2λ⁢log⁡2δ+32⁢(Hϵ(m))2⁢R4⁢L4λ2+2⁢(N(m)+m)⁢L2λ⁢d+2.superscript𝑀𝑚16superscriptsubscript𝐻italic-ϵ𝑚superscript𝑅2superscript𝐿2𝜆2𝛿32superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐻italic-ϵ𝑚2superscript𝑅4superscript𝐿4superscript𝜆22superscript𝑁𝑚𝑚superscript𝐿2𝜆𝑑2M^{(m)}=\frac{16H_{\epsilon}^{(m)}R^{2}L^{2}}{\lambda}\log\frac{2}{\delta}+% \frac{32(H_{\epsilon}^{(m)})^{2}R^{4}L^{4}}{\lambda^{2}}+\frac{2(N^{(m)}+m)L^{% 2}}{\lambda d}+2.italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 16 italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG + divide start_ARG 32 ( italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_m ) italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ italic_d end_ARG + 2 . ∎

B.2 Proof of Theorem 3

In this section, we present the proof of Theorem 3.

Theorem 3. LinTG makes n⁢log⁡(κ/α)/α𝑛𝜅𝛼𝛼n\log(\kappa/\alpha)/\alphaitalic_n roman_log ( italic_κ / italic_α ) / italic_α evaluations of the marginal gains. In addition, with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ, the following statements hold:

  1. 1.

    The function value of the output solution set S𝑆Sitalic_S satisfies that f⁢(S)≥(1−e−1−α)⁢f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−2⁢ϵ.𝑓𝑆1superscript𝑒1𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2italic-ϵf(S)\geq(1-e^{-1}-\alpha)f(OPT)-2\epsilon.italic_f ( italic_S ) ≥ ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α ) italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - 2 italic_ϵ . Here O⁢P⁢T𝑂𝑃𝑇OPTitalic_O italic_P italic_T is an optimal solution to the SM problem;

  2. 2.

    Assuming λ≤2⁢R2S2⁢log⁡2δ𝜆2superscript𝑅2superscript𝑆22𝛿\lambda\leq\frac{2R^{2}}{S^{2}}\log\frac{2}{\delta}italic_λ ≤ divide start_ARG 2 italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_S start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG, the m𝑚mitalic_m-th evaluation of the marginal gain of adding an element a𝑎aitalic_a to S𝑆Sitalic_S in LinTG takes at most

    ∑i∈[m]max⁡{4⁢Hi(m)⁢R2⁢(2⁢log⁡2δ+d⁢log⁡M(m))+1−Ni(m),0}subscript𝑖delimited-[]𝑚4subscriptsuperscript𝐻𝑚𝑖superscript𝑅222𝛿𝑑superscript𝑀𝑚1superscriptsubscript𝑁𝑖𝑚0\displaystyle\sum_{i\in[m]}\max\{4H^{(m)}_{i}R^{2}(2\log\frac{2}{\delta}+d\log M% ^{(m)})+1-N_{i}^{(m)},0\}∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_max { 4 italic_H start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( 2 roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG + italic_d roman_log italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) + 1 - italic_N start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , 0 }

    samples, where M(m)=16⁢Hϵ(m)⁢R2⁢L2λ⁢log⁡2δ+32⁢(Hϵ(m))2⁢R4⁢L4λ2+2⁢(N(m)+m)⁢L2λ⁢d+2superscript𝑀𝑚16superscriptsubscript𝐻italic-ϵ𝑚superscript𝑅2superscript𝐿2𝜆2𝛿32superscriptsuperscriptsubscript𝐻italic-ϵ𝑚2superscript𝑅4superscript𝐿4superscript𝜆22superscript𝑁𝑚𝑚superscript𝐿2𝜆𝑑2M^{(m)}=\frac{16H_{\epsilon}^{(m)}R^{2}L^{2}}{\lambda}\log\frac{2}{\delta}+% \frac{32(H_{\epsilon}^{(m)})^{2}R^{4}L^{4}}{\lambda^{2}}+\frac{2(N^{(m)}+m)L^{% 2}}{\lambda d}+2italic_M start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG 16 italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG + divide start_ARG 32 ( italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 4 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG + divide start_ARG 2 ( italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_m ) italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_λ italic_d end_ARG + 2. Here Hi(m)=pi∗⁢ρ(m)max{ϵ/κ+|w−Δ⁢F⁢(Sm,am)T⁢w|2,ϵ/κ}2H_{i}^{(m)}=\frac{p^{*}_{i}\rho^{(m)}}{\max\{\frac{\epsilon/\kappa+|w-\Delta% \textbf{F}(S_{m},a_{m})^{T}\textbf{w}|}{2},\epsilon/\kappa\}^{2}}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = divide start_ARG italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ρ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG roman_max { divide start_ARG italic_ϵ / italic_κ + | italic_w - roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_m end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT w | end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG , italic_ϵ / italic_κ } start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG and Hϵ(m)=∑i∈[m]Hi(m)superscriptsubscript𝐻italic-ϵ𝑚subscript𝑖delimited-[]𝑚superscriptsubscript𝐻𝑖𝑚H_{\epsilon}^{(m)}=\sum_{i\in[m]}H_{i}^{(m)}italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_ϵ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_m ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT. pi∗subscriptsuperscript𝑝𝑖p^{*}_{i}italic_p start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∗ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the fraction of samples allocated to sample Δ⁢F⁢(Si,ai)ΔFsubscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖\Delta\textbf{F}(S_{i},a_{i})roman_Δ F ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ). N(m)superscript𝑁𝑚N^{(m)}italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT is the total number of samples before the m𝑚mitalic_m-th evaluation of marginal gains. Ni(m)subscriptsuperscript𝑁𝑚𝑖N^{(m)}_{i}italic_N start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( italic_m ) end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is the number of samples to the marginal gain Δ⁢f⁢(Si,ai)Δ𝑓subscript𝑆𝑖subscript𝑎𝑖\Delta f(S_{i},a_{i})roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) before the m𝑚mitalic_m-th evaluation of marginal gains.

The second result can be obtained by applying the result in Lemma 6. To prove the first result, we first present a series of needed lemmas. In order for the guarantees of Theorem 3 to hold, two random events must occur during LG. The first event is that the estimate of the max singleton value of f𝑓fitalic_f on Line 5 in LG is an ϵitalic-ϵ\epsilonitalic_ϵ-approximation of its true value. More formally, we have the following lemma.

Lemma 9.

With probability at least 1−δ/31𝛿31-\delta/31 - italic_δ / 3, we have maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)−ϵ≤g≤maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)+ϵsubscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ\max_{s\in U}f(s)-\epsilon\leq g\leq\max_{s\in U}f(s)+\epsilonroman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) - italic_ϵ ≤ italic_g ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) + italic_ϵ.

Proof.

For a fix s∈U𝑠𝑈s\in Uitalic_s ∈ italic_U, by Hoeffding’s inequality we would have that

P⁢(|f^⁢(s)−f⁢(s)|≥ϵ)≤δ3⁢n.𝑃^𝑓𝑠𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ𝛿3𝑛\displaystyle P(|\hat{f}(s)-f(s)|\geq\epsilon)\leq\frac{\delta}{3n}.italic_P ( | over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_s ) - italic_f ( italic_s ) | ≥ italic_ϵ ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 3 italic_n end_ARG . (18)

Taking a union bound over all elements we would have that

P(∃s∈U,s.t.|f^(s)−f(s)|≥ϵ)≤δ3.\displaystyle P(\exists s\in U,s.t.|\hat{f}(s)-f(s)|\geq\epsilon)\leq\frac{% \delta}{3}.italic_P ( ∃ italic_s ∈ italic_U , italic_s . italic_t . | over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_s ) - italic_f ( italic_s ) | ≥ italic_ϵ ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 3 end_ARG .

Then with probability at least 1−δ31𝛿31-\frac{\delta}{3}1 - divide start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG start_ARG 3 end_ARG, |f^⁢(s)−f⁢(s)|≤ϵ^𝑓𝑠𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ|\hat{f}(s)-f(s)|\leq\epsilon| over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_s ) - italic_f ( italic_s ) | ≤ italic_ϵ for all s∈U𝑠𝑈s\in Uitalic_s ∈ italic_U. It then follows that ∀s∈Ufor-all𝑠𝑈\forall s\in U∀ italic_s ∈ italic_U, f⁢(s)−ϵ≤f^⁢(s)≤f⁢(s)+ϵ𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ^𝑓𝑠𝑓𝑠italic-ϵf(s)-\epsilon\leq\hat{f}(s)\leq f(s)+\epsilonitalic_f ( italic_s ) - italic_ϵ ≤ over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_s ) ≤ italic_f ( italic_s ) + italic_ϵ. Therefore

maxs∈U⁡(f⁢(s)−ϵ)≤maxs∈U⁡f^⁢(s)≤maxs∈U⁡(f⁢(s)+ϵ).subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵsubscript𝑠𝑈^𝑓𝑠subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ\max_{s\in U}(f(s)-\epsilon)\leq\max_{s\in U}\hat{f}(s)\leq\max_{s\in U}(f(s)+% \epsilon).roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_s ) - italic_ϵ ) ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT over^ start_ARG italic_f end_ARG ( italic_s ) ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_f ( italic_s ) + italic_ϵ ) .

Thus we have

maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)−ϵ≤g≤maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)+ϵ.subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ𝑔subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ\displaystyle\max_{s\in U}f(s)-\epsilon\leq g\leq\max_{s\in U}f(s)+\epsilon.roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) - italic_ϵ ≤ italic_g ≤ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) + italic_ϵ .

∎

With the above Lemma 9 and Lemma 6, and by taking the union bound, we have that with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ, the two events in Lemma 9 and Lemma 6 both hold during the LG. Our next step is to show that if both of the events occur during LG, the approximation guarantees and sample complexity of Theorem 3 hold. To this end, we need the following Lemma 10.

Lemma 10.

Assume the events defined in Lemma 9 and Lemma 6 above hold during LG. Then for any element s𝑠sitalic_s that is added to the solution set S𝑆Sitalic_S, the following statement holds.

Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)≥1−ακ⁢(f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−f⁢(S))−2⁢ϵ.Δ𝑓𝑆𝑠1𝛼𝜅𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇𝑓𝑆2italic-ϵ\displaystyle\Delta f(S,s)\geq\frac{1-\alpha}{\kappa}(f(OPT)-f(S))-2\epsilon.roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥ divide start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG ( italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - italic_f ( italic_S ) ) - 2 italic_ϵ .
Proof.

At the first round in the for loop from Line 12 to Line 35 in Algorithm 2, if an element s𝑠sitalic_s is added to the solution set, it holds by Lemma 9 that Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)≥w−ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑠𝑤italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,s)\geq w-\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥ italic_w - italic_ϵ. Since at the first round w=g𝑤𝑔w=gitalic_w = italic_g and g≥maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)−ϵ𝑔subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠italic-ϵg\geq\max_{s\in U}f(s)-\epsilonitalic_g ≥ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) - italic_ϵ. It follows that Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)≥maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)−2⁢ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑠subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠2italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,s)\geq\max_{s\in U}f(s)-2\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) - 2 italic_ϵ. By submodularity we have that κ⁢maxs∈U⁡f⁢(s)≥f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)𝜅subscript𝑠𝑈𝑓𝑠𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇\kappa\max_{s\in U}f(s)\geq f(OPT)italic_κ roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_U end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) ≥ italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ). Therefore, Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)≥f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−f⁢(S)κ−2⁢ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑠𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇𝑓𝑆𝜅2italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,s)\geq\frac{f(OPT)-f(S)}{\kappa}-2\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥ divide start_ARG italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - italic_f ( italic_S ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG - 2 italic_ϵ.

At the round i𝑖iitalic_i in the for loop from Line 12 to Line 35 where i>1𝑖1i>1italic_i > 1, if an element o∈O⁢P⁢T𝑜𝑂𝑃𝑇o\in OPTitalic_o ∈ italic_O italic_P italic_T is not added to the solution set, then it is not added to the solution at the last iteration, where the threshold is w1−α𝑤1𝛼\frac{w}{1-\alpha}divide start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG. By Lemma 4, we have Δ⁢f⁢(S,o)≤w1−α+ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑜𝑤1𝛼italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,o)\leq\frac{w}{1-\alpha}+\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_o ) ≤ divide start_ARG italic_w end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG + italic_ϵ. Since for any element s𝑠sitalic_s that is added to the solution at iteration i𝑖iitalic_i, by Lemma 4 it holds that Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)≥w−ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑠𝑤italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,s)\geq w-\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥ italic_w - italic_ϵ. Therefore, we have

Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)Δ𝑓𝑆𝑠\displaystyle\Delta f(S,s)roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥w−ϵabsent𝑤italic-ϵ\displaystyle\geq w-\epsilon≥ italic_w - italic_ϵ
≥(1−α)⁢(Δ⁢f⁢(S,o)−ϵ)−ϵabsent1𝛼Δ𝑓𝑆𝑜italic-ϵitalic-ϵ\displaystyle\geq(1-\alpha)(\Delta f(S,o)-\epsilon)-\epsilon≥ ( 1 - italic_α ) ( roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_o ) - italic_ϵ ) - italic_ϵ
≥(1−α)⁢Δ⁢f⁢(S,o)−2⁢ϵ.absent1𝛼Δ𝑓𝑆𝑜2italic-ϵ\displaystyle\geq(1-\alpha)\Delta f(S,o)-2\epsilon.≥ ( 1 - italic_α ) roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_o ) - 2 italic_ϵ .

By submodularity, it holds that Δ⁢f⁢(S,s)≥(1−α)⁢f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−f⁢(S)κ−2⁢ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑠1𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇𝑓𝑆𝜅2italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,s)\geq(1-\alpha)\frac{f(OPT)-f(S)}{\kappa}-2\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_s ) ≥ ( 1 - italic_α ) divide start_ARG italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - italic_f ( italic_S ) end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG - 2 italic_ϵ. ∎

We now prove Theorem 3, which relies on the previous Lemma 9, 6 and 10.

Proof.

The events defined in Lemma 6, 9 hold with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ by combining Lemma 6, 9, and taking the union bound. Therefore in order to prove Theorem 3, we assume that both the two events have occurred. The proof of the first result in the theorem depends on the Lemma 10. First, consider the case where the output solution set satisfies |S|=κ𝑆𝜅|S|=\kappa| italic_S | = italic_κ. Denote the solution set S𝑆Sitalic_S after the i𝑖iitalic_i-th element is added as Sisubscript𝑆𝑖S_{i}italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Then by Lemma 10, we have

f⁢(Si+1)≥1−ακ⁢f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)+(1−1−ακ)⁢f⁢(Si)−2⁢ϵ.𝑓subscript𝑆𝑖11𝛼𝜅𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇11𝛼𝜅𝑓subscript𝑆𝑖2italic-ϵ\displaystyle f(S_{i+1})\geq\frac{1-\alpha}{\kappa}f(OPT)+(1-\frac{1-\alpha}{% \kappa})f(S_{i})-2\epsilon.italic_f ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i + 1 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ divide start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) + ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG ) italic_f ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) - 2 italic_ϵ .

By induction, we have that

f⁢(Sκ)𝑓subscript𝑆𝜅\displaystyle f(S_{\kappa})italic_f ( italic_S start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_κ end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥(1−(1−1−ακ)κ)⁢{f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−2⁢κ⁢ϵ1−α}absent1superscript11𝛼𝜅𝜅𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2𝜅italic-ϵ1𝛼\displaystyle\geq(1-(1-\frac{1-\alpha}{\kappa})^{\kappa})\{f(OPT)-\frac{2% \kappa\epsilon}{1-\alpha}\}≥ ( 1 - ( 1 - divide start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_κ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) { italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - divide start_ARG 2 italic_κ italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG }
≥(1−e−1+α)⁢{f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−2⁢κ⁢ϵ1−α}absent1superscript𝑒1𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2𝜅italic-ϵ1𝛼\displaystyle\geq(1-e^{-1+\alpha})\{f(OPT)-\frac{2\kappa\epsilon}{1-\alpha}\}≥ ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 + italic_α end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) { italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - divide start_ARG 2 italic_κ italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG }
≥(1−e−1−α)⁢{f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−2⁢κ⁢ϵ1−α}absent1superscript𝑒1𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2𝜅italic-ϵ1𝛼\displaystyle\geq(1-e^{-1}-\alpha)\{f(OPT)-\frac{2\kappa\epsilon}{1-\alpha}\}≥ ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α ) { italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - divide start_ARG 2 italic_κ italic_ϵ end_ARG start_ARG 1 - italic_α end_ARG }
≥(1−e−1−α)⁢f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−2⁢κ⁢ϵ.absent1superscript𝑒1𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2𝜅italic-ϵ\displaystyle\geq(1-e^{-1}-\alpha)f(OPT)-2\kappa\epsilon.≥ ( 1 - italic_e start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_α ) italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - 2 italic_κ italic_ϵ .

If the size of the output solution set S𝑆Sitalic_S is smaller than κ𝜅\kappaitalic_κ, then any element o∈O⁢P⁢T𝑜𝑂𝑃𝑇o\in OPTitalic_o ∈ italic_O italic_P italic_T that is not added to S𝑆Sitalic_S at the last iteration satisfies that Δ⁢f⁢(S,o)≤w+ϵΔ𝑓𝑆𝑜𝑤italic-ϵ\Delta f(S,o)\leq w+\epsilonroman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_o ) ≤ italic_w + italic_ϵ. Since the threshold w𝑤witalic_w in the last iteration satisfies that w≤α⁢dκ𝑤𝛼𝑑𝜅w\leq\frac{\alpha d}{\kappa}italic_w ≤ divide start_ARG italic_α italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG, we have

Δ⁢f⁢(S,o)Δ𝑓𝑆𝑜\displaystyle\Delta f(S,o)roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_o ) ≤α⁢dκ+ϵ.absent𝛼𝑑𝜅italic-ϵ\displaystyle\leq\frac{\alpha d}{\kappa}+\epsilon.≤ divide start_ARG italic_α italic_d end_ARG start_ARG italic_κ end_ARG + italic_ϵ .

It follows that

∑o∈O⁢P⁢T\SΔ⁢f⁢(S,o)subscript𝑜\𝑂𝑃𝑇𝑆Δ𝑓𝑆𝑜\displaystyle\sum_{o\in OPT\backslash S}\Delta f(S,o)∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_o ∈ italic_O italic_P italic_T \ italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT roman_Δ italic_f ( italic_S , italic_o ) ≤α⁢(maxs∈S⁡f⁢(s)+ϵ)+κ⁢ϵabsent𝛼subscript𝑠𝑆𝑓𝑠italic-ϵ𝜅italic-ϵ\displaystyle\leq\alpha(\max_{s\in S}f(s)+\epsilon)+\kappa\epsilon≤ italic_α ( roman_max start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_s ∈ italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_f ( italic_s ) + italic_ϵ ) + italic_κ italic_ϵ
≤α⁢f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)+2⁢κ⁢ϵ.absent𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2𝜅italic-ϵ\displaystyle\leq\alpha f(OPT)+2\kappa\epsilon.≤ italic_α italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) + 2 italic_κ italic_ϵ .

By submodularity and monotonicity of f𝑓fitalic_f, we have f⁢(S)≥(1−α)⁢f⁢(O⁢P⁢T)−2⁢κ⁢ϵ𝑓𝑆1𝛼𝑓𝑂𝑃𝑇2𝜅italic-ϵf(S)\geq(1-\alpha)f(OPT)-2\kappa\epsilonitalic_f ( italic_S ) ≥ ( 1 - italic_α ) italic_f ( italic_O italic_P italic_T ) - 2 italic_κ italic_ϵ.

∎

Appendix C Appendix for Section 5

In this section, we present supplementary material to Section 5. In particular, we present the missing details about the experimental setup in Section C.1, and the additional experimental results in Section C.2.

C.1 Experimental setup

First of all, we provide more details about the movie recommendation dataset MovieLens 25M dataset Harper and Konstan [2015] used to evaluate the algorithms proposed in the main paper. The dataset contains ratings on a 5-star scale of X=13,816𝑋13816X=13,816italic_X = 13 , 816 movies by the users. Each movie x𝑥xitalic_x is associated with 1,12811281,1281 , 128 topics and a relevance score is assigned to each movie and each topic. Here we use G⁢(x,i)𝐺𝑥𝑖G(x,i)italic_G ( italic_x , italic_i ) to denote the relevance score of movie x𝑥xitalic_x and the topic i𝑖iitalic_i. In addition, we use R⁢(a,x)𝑅𝑎𝑥R(a,x)italic_R ( italic_a , italic_x ) to denote the rating of user a𝑎aitalic_a for the movie x𝑥xitalic_x. Since the number of topics is too large for our experiments, we select a small subset of topics by the following procedure. To extract the most relevant topics, we conduct correlation analysis to select a subset of topics. For each pair of features i𝑖iitalic_i and j𝑗jitalic_j, if C⁢o⁢r⁢(i,j)≥0.4𝐶𝑜𝑟𝑖𝑗0.4Cor(i,j)\geq 0.4italic_C italic_o italic_r ( italic_i , italic_j ) ≥ 0.4 then either i𝑖iitalic_i or j𝑗jitalic_j is removed from the tag list. Subsequently, we remove any features that are negatively or weakly correlated to the ratings, i.e., ∀ifor-all𝑖\forall i∀ italic_i if C⁢o⁢r⁢(i,s)≤0.2𝐶𝑜𝑟𝑖𝑠0.2Cor(i,s)\leq 0.2italic_C italic_o italic_r ( italic_i , italic_s ) ≤ 0.2 then i𝑖iitalic_i is removed from the list. In this way, we select 79797979 tags. Then we randomly select different number of topics to use as the features.

In the experiments, the submodular basis functions {Fi}i∈[d]subscriptsubscriptF𝑖𝑖delimited-[]𝑑\{\textbf{F}_{i}\}_{i\in[d]}{ F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT } start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i ∈ [ italic_d ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is defined by the probabilistic coverage model. Next, we present the definition of the probabilistic coverage model, which captures how well a topic is covered by a subset of items Hiranandani et al. [2020], Yu et al. [2016]. The problem definition is as follows.

Definition 2.

(probabilistic coverage model) Suppose there are a total of n𝑛nitalic_n elements denoted as U𝑈Uitalic_U. For each element x𝑥xitalic_x and each topic i𝑖iitalic_i, let G⁢(x,i)𝐺𝑥𝑖G(x,i)italic_G ( italic_x , italic_i ) be the relevance score that quantifies how relevant the movie x𝑥xitalic_x is to the topic i𝑖iitalic_i. For any tag i𝑖iitalic_i and subset of elements S𝑆Sitalic_S, function Fi⁢(S)subscript𝐹𝑖𝑆F_{i}(S)italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_S ) is defined to be

Fi⁢(S)=1−∏x∈S(1−G⁢(x,i)).subscript𝐹𝑖𝑆1subscriptproduct𝑥𝑆1𝐺𝑥𝑖\displaystyle F_{i}(S)=1-\prod_{x\in S}(1-G(x,i)).italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_S ) = 1 - ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_G ( italic_x , italic_i ) ) .

Therefore, the marginal gain of adding a new movie x𝑥xitalic_x to a subset S𝑆Sitalic_S is defined as

Δ⁢Fi⁢(S,x)=G⁢(x,i)⁢∏x′∈S(1−G⁢(x′,i)),∀x∉S.formulae-sequenceΔsubscript𝐹𝑖𝑆𝑥𝐺𝑥𝑖subscriptproductsuperscript𝑥′𝑆1𝐺superscript𝑥′𝑖for-all𝑥𝑆\displaystyle\Delta F_{i}(S,x)=G(x,i)\prod_{x^{\prime}\in S}(1-G(x^{\prime},i)% ),\qquad\forall x\notin S.roman_Δ italic_F start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_i end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( italic_S , italic_x ) = italic_G ( italic_x , italic_i ) ∏ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ italic_S end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( 1 - italic_G ( italic_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT , italic_i ) ) , ∀ italic_x ∉ italic_S .

For each user, we calculate the preference of the user for different topics as follows.

w⁢(a,i)=∑x∈XR⁢(a,x)⁢G⁢(x,i)∑x∈X,i′∈[d]R⁢(a,x)⁢G⁢(x,i′),𝑤𝑎𝑖subscript𝑥𝑋𝑅𝑎𝑥𝐺𝑥𝑖subscriptformulae-sequence𝑥𝑋superscript𝑖′delimited-[]𝑑𝑅𝑎𝑥𝐺𝑥superscript𝑖′\displaystyle w(a,i)=\frac{\sum_{x\in X}R(a,x)G(x,i)}{\sum_{x\in X,i^{\prime}% \in[d]}R(a,x)G(x,i^{\prime})},italic_w ( italic_a , italic_i ) = divide start_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ italic_X end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R ( italic_a , italic_x ) italic_G ( italic_x , italic_i ) end_ARG start_ARG ∑ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_x ∈ italic_X , italic_i start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ∈ [ italic_d ] end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_R ( italic_a , italic_x ) italic_G ( italic_x , italic_i start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ′ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) end_ARG ,

where X𝑋Xitalic_X is the set of movies.

Next, we describe more details about the algorithms that we compare to in the experiments. The TG algorithm that we compare to is based on the threshold greedy algorithm with the evaluation of marginal gain being replaced by the repeated sampling approach. Therefore, by applying the Hoeffding’s inequality, TG achieves the same approximation ratio as our algorithms. The algorithm EXP-GREEDY is proposed in Singla et al. [2016] and is based on the standard greedy algorithm with the element selecting procedure in each greedy round replaced by the CLUCB algorithm for best arm identification for general bandit. The algorithm TG doesn’t utilize the linear structure either. As a result, these algorithms can’t be used to reuse previous samples.

C.2 Exprimental results

The additional results of the experiments are presented in Figure 2. From the results, we can see that the exact function value of different algorithms are almost the same. On the ”movie5000” dataset, the sample complexity of our proposed method LinTG-H is much smaller than TG, which demonstrates the sample efficiency of our algorithm.

Appendix D Technical Lemmas and Details

D.1 Matrix Computations and Runtime

In this section, we present the missing discussions on the implementation and runtime of the matrix inverse and multiplications in the main paper.

Inverse of matrix. Notice that all of the subroutine algorithms presented in the main paper keep track of At−1superscriptsubscriptA𝑡1\textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT throughout the algorithm. From Lemma 11, we can see that the inverse of (At+xxT)subscriptA𝑡superscriptxx𝑇(\textbf{A}_{t}+\textbf{x}\textbf{x}^{T})( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_x bold_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) can be computed as

(At+xxT)−1=At−1−(At−1⁢x)⁢(At−1⁢x)T1+xT⁢At−1⁢x,superscriptsubscriptA𝑡superscriptxx𝑇1superscriptsubscriptA𝑡1superscriptsubscriptA𝑡1xsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡1x𝑇1superscriptx𝑇superscriptsubscriptA𝑡1x(\textbf{A}_{t}+\textbf{x}\textbf{x}^{T})^{-1}=\textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}-\frac{(% \textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}\textbf{x})(\textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}\textbf{x})^{T}}{1+\textbf{x% }^{T}\textbf{A}_{t}^{-1}\textbf{x}},( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + bold_x bold_x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT x ) ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT x ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG 1 + x start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT x end_ARG ,

for any x∈Ux𝑈\textbf{x}\in Ux ∈ italic_U. This step takes O⁢(d2)𝑂superscript𝑑2O(d^{2})italic_O ( italic_d start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) in time complexity.

D.2 Technical Lemmas

Proposition 5.

(Proposition 1 in Soare et al. [2014]). Suppose the feature vector set is denoted as 𝒳𝒳\mathcal{X}caligraphic_X with |𝒳|=n𝒳𝑛|\mathcal{X}|=n| caligraphic_X | = italic_n. Let w^tsubscript^w𝑡\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT be the solution to the least-squares problem and let At=XtT⁢XtsubscriptA𝑡superscriptsubscriptX𝑡𝑇subscriptX𝑡\textbf{A}_{t}=\textbf{X}_{t}^{T}\textbf{X}_{t}A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, and assume the noise variable ξtsubscript𝜉𝑡\xi_{t}italic_ξ start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is R𝑅Ritalic_R-sub-Gaussian. Assume 𝒴𝒴\mathcal{Y}caligraphic_Y is a subset of ℝdsuperscriptℝ𝑑\mathbb{R}^{d}blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT with that |𝒴|=Y𝒴𝑌|\mathcal{Y}|=Y| caligraphic_Y | = italic_Y. Then for all y∈𝒴y𝒴\textbf{y}\in\mathcal{Y}y ∈ caligraphic_Y and any fixed sequence xtsubscriptx𝑡\textbf{x}_{t}x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, we have that with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ, it holds that

|yT⁢(w^t−w)|≤R⁢‖y‖(At)−1⁢2⁢log⁡(π2⁢t2⁢Y3⁢δ)superscripty𝑇subscript^w𝑡w𝑅subscriptnormysuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡12superscript𝜋2superscript𝑡2𝑌3𝛿\displaystyle|\textbf{y}^{T}(\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}-\textbf{w})|\leq R||\textbf{% y}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t})^{-1}}\sqrt{2\log(\frac{\pi^{2}t^{2}Y}{3\delta})}| y start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT - w ) | ≤ italic_R | | y | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT square-root start_ARG 2 roman_log ( divide start_ARG italic_π start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_t start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_Y end_ARG start_ARG 3 italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG

for all t>0𝑡0t>0italic_t > 0.

Proposition 1. Let w^tλsuperscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}^{\lambda}over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT be the solution to the regularized least-squares problem with regularizer λ𝜆\lambdaitalic_λ and let Atλ=XtT⁢Xt+λ⁢IsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆superscriptsubscriptX𝑡𝑇subscriptX𝑡𝜆I\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda}=\textbf{X}_{t}^{T}\textbf{X}_{t}+\lambda\textbf{I}A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT + italic_λ I. Then for every adaptive sequence XtsubscriptX𝑡\textbf{X}_{t}X start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT such that at any step t, xatsubscriptxsubscript𝑎𝑡\textbf{x}_{a_{t}}x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT only depends on past history, we have that with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ, it holds that for all t≥0𝑡0t\geq 0italic_t ≥ 0 and all yt∈ℝdsubscripty𝑡superscriptℝ𝑑\textbf{y}_{t}\in\mathbb{R}^{d}y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT that only depends on past history up to time t𝑡titalic_t,

|ytT⁢(w^tλ−w)|≤‖yt‖(Atλ)−1⁢Ct,superscriptsubscripty𝑡𝑇superscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆wsubscriptnormsubscripty𝑡superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆1subscript𝐶𝑡\displaystyle|\textbf{y}_{t}^{T}(\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}^{\lambda}-\textbf{w})|% \leq||\textbf{y}_{t}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{-1}}C_{t},| y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - w ) | ≤ | | y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ,

where Ctsubscript𝐶𝑡C_{t}italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is defined as

Ct=R⁢2⁢log⁡det(Atλ)12⁢det(λ⁢I)−12δ+λ12⁢S.subscript𝐶𝑡𝑅2superscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆12superscript𝜆𝐼12𝛿superscript𝜆12𝑆\displaystyle C_{t}=R\sqrt{2\log\frac{\det(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{\frac{1}% {2}}\det(\lambda I)^{-\frac{1}{2}}}{\delta}}+\lambda^{\frac{1}{2}}S.italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT = italic_R square-root start_ARG 2 roman_log divide start_ARG roman_det ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT roman_det ( italic_λ italic_I ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG end_ARG + italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_S .

Moreover, if ‖xat‖≤Lnormsubscriptxsubscript𝑎𝑡𝐿||\textbf{x}_{a_{t}}||\leq L| | x start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_a start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | | ≤ italic_L holds for all t>0𝑡0t>0italic_t > 0, then

Ct≤R⁢d⁢log⁡(1+t⁢L2/λδ)+λ12⁢S.subscript𝐶𝑡𝑅𝑑1𝑡superscript𝐿2𝜆𝛿superscript𝜆12𝑆\displaystyle C_{t}\leq R\sqrt{d\log(\frac{1+tL^{2}/\lambda}{\delta})}+\lambda% ^{\frac{1}{2}}S.italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_R square-root start_ARG italic_d roman_log ( divide start_ARG 1 + italic_t italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_λ end_ARG start_ARG italic_δ end_ARG ) end_ARG + italic_λ start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT divide start_ARG 1 end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_S .
Proof.

Let us denote the history up to time t as ℋtsubscriptℋ𝑡\mathcal{H}_{t}caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, then by Cauchy–Schwarz inequality, we have that for each fixed time t𝑡titalic_t

P⁢(|ytT⁢(w^tλ−w)|≤‖y‖(Atλ)−1⁢Ct,∀yt⁢ depend on ⁢ℋt|ℋt)≥P⁢(‖w^tλ−w‖(Atλ)−1≤Ct|ℋt)𝑃superscriptsubscripty𝑡𝑇superscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆wsubscriptnormysuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆1subscript𝐶𝑡conditionalfor-allsubscripty𝑡 depend on subscriptℋ𝑡subscriptℋ𝑡𝑃subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆wsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆1conditionalsubscript𝐶𝑡subscriptℋ𝑡\displaystyle P(|\textbf{y}_{t}^{T}(\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}^{\lambda}-\textbf{w})% |\leq||\textbf{y}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{-1}}C_{t},\forall\textbf{y}_{% t}\text{ depend on }\mathcal{H}_{t}|\mathcal{H}_{t})\geq P(||\hat{\textbf{w}}_% {t}^{\lambda}-\textbf{w}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{-1}}\leq C_{t}|% \mathcal{H}_{t})italic_P ( | y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - w ) | ≤ | | y | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ∀ y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT depend on caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ italic_P ( | | over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - w | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT | caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT )

It then follows that

P⁢(|ytT⁢(w^tλ−w)|≤‖y‖(Atλ)−1⁢Ct,∀yt⁢ depend on ⁢ℋt)≥P⁢(‖w^tλ−w‖(Atλ)−1≤Ct).𝑃superscriptsubscripty𝑡𝑇superscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆wsubscriptnormysuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆1subscript𝐶𝑡for-allsubscripty𝑡 depend on subscriptℋ𝑡𝑃subscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆wsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆1subscript𝐶𝑡\displaystyle P(|\textbf{y}_{t}^{T}(\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}^{\lambda}-\textbf{w})% |\leq||\textbf{y}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{-1}}C_{t},\forall\textbf{y}_{% t}\text{ depend on }\mathcal{H}_{t})\geq P(||\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}^{\lambda}-% \textbf{w}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{-1}}\leq C_{t}).italic_P ( | y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_T end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ( over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - w ) | ≤ | | y | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT , ∀ y start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT depend on caligraphic_H start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≥ italic_P ( | | over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - w | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) .

From Theorem 2 in Abbasi-Yadkori et al. [2011], we can see that with probability at least 1−δ1𝛿1-\delta1 - italic_δ, at any step t𝑡titalic_t, ‖w^tλ−w‖(Atλ)−1≤Ctsubscriptnormsuperscriptsubscript^w𝑡𝜆wsuperscriptsuperscriptsubscriptA𝑡𝜆1subscript𝐶𝑡||\hat{\textbf{w}}_{t}^{\lambda}-\textbf{w}||_{(\textbf{A}_{t}^{\lambda})^{-1}% }\leq C_{t}| | over^ start_ARG w end_ARG start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - w | | start_POSTSUBSCRIPT ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_λ end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ≤ italic_C start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT. Therefore, by applying this result and taking a union bound over all time step t𝑡titalic_t, we can prove the result in the proposition. ∎

Lemma 11.

(Woodbury formula. ) The inverse of matrix A+U⁢C⁢V𝐴𝑈𝐶𝑉A+UCVitalic_A + italic_U italic_C italic_V can be computed as

(A+U⁢C⁢V)−1=A−1−A−1⁢U⁢(C−1+V⁢A−1⁢U)−1⁢V⁢A−1.superscript𝐴𝑈𝐶𝑉1superscript𝐴1superscript𝐴1𝑈superscriptsuperscript𝐶1𝑉superscript𝐴1𝑈1𝑉superscript𝐴1\displaystyle(A+UCV)^{-1}=A^{-1}-A^{-1}U(C^{-1}+VA^{-1}U)^{-1}VA^{-1}.( italic_A + italic_U italic_C italic_V ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT = italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_U ( italic_C start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT + italic_V italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_U ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_V italic_A start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT - 1 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT .
Lemma 12.

(Abbasi-Yadkori et al. [2011], Lemma 10) Let the maximum l2subscript𝑙2l_{2}italic_l start_POSTSUBSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUBSCRIPT-norm of the feature vectors be denoted as L𝐿Litalic_L. The determinant of matrix AtsubscriptA𝑡\textbf{A}_{t}A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT is bounded as

d⁢e⁢t⁢(At)≤(λ+t⁢L2/d)d𝑑𝑒𝑡subscriptA𝑡superscript𝜆𝑡superscript𝐿2𝑑𝑑\displaystyle det(\textbf{A}_{t})\leq(\lambda+tL^{2}/d)^{d}italic_d italic_e italic_t ( A start_POSTSUBSCRIPT italic_t end_POSTSUBSCRIPT ) ≤ ( italic_λ + italic_t italic_L start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT 2 end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT / italic_d ) start_POSTSUPERSCRIPT italic_d end_POSTSUPERSCRIPT
Lemma 13.

Moreover, we have that

where ρ𝜌\rhoitalic_ρ is the optimal value of the optimization problem in (19).

Proof.

The proof can be found in Appendix B in Xu et al. [2018], so we omit the proof here. ∎

Lemma 14.

Suppose x∈ℝ𝑥ℝx\in\mathbb{R}italic_x ∈ blackboard_R and x≥2𝑥2x\geq 2italic_x ≥ 2, if we have x≥2a⁢log⁡2a𝑥2𝑎2𝑎x\geq\frac{2}{a}\log\frac{2}{a}italic_x ≥ divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG, then it holds that

log⁡xx≤a𝑥𝑥𝑎\displaystyle\frac{\log x}{x}\leq adivide start_ARG roman_log italic_x end_ARG start_ARG italic_x end_ARG ≤ italic_a
Proof.

Since y=log⁡xx𝑦𝑥𝑥y=\frac{\log x}{x}italic_y = divide start_ARG roman_log italic_x end_ARG start_ARG italic_x end_ARG is decreasing when x≥2𝑥2x\geq 2italic_x ≥ 2, if x>2a⁢log⁡2a𝑥2𝑎2𝑎x>\frac{2}{a}\log\frac{2}{a}italic_x > divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG, then we have

log⁡xx<a2⋅log⁡(2a⁢log⁡2a)log⁡2a≤a.𝑥𝑥⋅𝑎22𝑎2𝑎2𝑎𝑎\displaystyle\frac{\log x}{x}<\frac{a}{2}\cdot\frac{\log(\frac{2}{a}\log\frac{% 2}{a})}{\log\frac{2}{a}}\leq a.divide start_ARG roman_log italic_x end_ARG start_ARG italic_x end_ARG < divide start_ARG italic_a end_ARG start_ARG 2 end_ARG ⋅ divide start_ARG roman_log ( divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG ) end_ARG start_ARG roman_log divide start_ARG 2 end_ARG start_ARG italic_a end_ARG end_ARG ≤ italic_a .

∎

Lemma 15.

Suppose x,a,b∈ℝ+𝑥𝑎𝑏subscriptℝx,a,b\in\mathbb{R}_{+}italic_x , italic_a , italic_b ∈ blackboard_R start_POSTSUBSCRIPT + end_POSTSUBSCRIPT, if we have x≤a+b⁢log⁡x𝑥𝑎𝑏𝑥x\leq a+b\log xitalic_x ≤ italic_a + italic_b roman_log italic_x, then it holds that

x≤2⁢a+2⁢b⁢log⁡b.𝑥2𝑎2𝑏𝑏\displaystyle x\leq 2a+2b\log b.italic_x ≤ 2 italic_a + 2 italic_b roman_log italic_b .
